subsections.title: Net-zero goal and strategy
text: Turkmenistan does not have a net zero goal or strategy.

subsections.title: Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC)
text: Turkmenistan has so far only submitted an “intended” nationally determined contribution (INDC), which does not include quantifiable targets.

subsections.title: Fossil fuel phase-out policy
text: Turkmenistan does not have a fossil fuel phase-out policy.

subsections.title: Power policy
text: Turkmenistan has very little policy around renewable energy. The country is primarily fueled by natural gas and has very large natural gas reserves, making renewables unappealing. Its 2014 national strategy on climate change has an intention to increase renewables, but there has not been any concrete follow-up policy to date. The country aims to increase generation capacity by building 14 new gas turbine power stations.

subsections.title: Power prices and costs
text: Until 2019, all citizens received free access to a set amount of electricity. Since that ended, many citizens now are unable to pay their utility bills, so the government is also refusing them access to subsidized food, which is necessary due to high food costs in response to Covid-19.

subsections.title: Power market
text: Turkmenistan’s power market is dominated by Turkmenenergo, the state-run utility. There is no indication that third parties are able to enter any segment of the market.

subsections.title: Doing business and barriers
text: The primary barriers to doing business in Turkmenistan are the lack of policies and information. Additionally, the power fleet is aging, but modernization programs are dependent on international donor support. There is no official plan in place.

subsections.title: EV market
text: The government has yet to implement any substantive policy support in this sector, and the EV market remains at an early stage.

subsections.title: EV policy
text: The government has yet to implement any substantive policy support in this sector and the EV market remains at an early stage.

subsections.title: Doing business and barriers
text: The government has yet to implement any substantive policy support in this sector and the EV market remains at an early stage.

subsections.title: Buildings market
text: Turkmenistan implemented building codes that provide for minimal energy savings for heating within residential buildings.

Working with the United Nations Development Programme, Turkmenistan implemented the Improving Energy Efficiency in the Housing Sector of Turkmenistan policy in 2011, but documentation is not readily available. It appears the goal of the policy is to increase energy efficiency through thermal insulation and building standards.

subsections.title: Buildings policy
text: The government has yet to implement any substantive policy support in this sector and the low-carbon heat market remains at an early stage.

subsections.title: Doing business and barriers
text: The government has yet to implement any substantive policy support in this sector and the low-carbon heat market remains at an early stage.
